div.p: Most illustrious man, I hope to come to you shortly; now it was not possible, for I am going directly to Stuttgart. I sent you letters, which should have been given to Mr. Franz Betto, now I add, if he is absent, they should be given to Mr. Werner von Castiano.
Mr. Viclamus de Schartres, a Frenchman, a great man in every respect, whom I love greatly, was recently in TÃ¼bingen; there our friendship was initiated.
You indeed have many who love and honor you, but I think there is no one who loves you more and holds you in higher regard.
Therefore, you ought to love in return.

Farewell and be well, dearest Bullinger; greet for me the family, the school, and the church; for thus I am accustomed with you. May the heavenly Father increase His gifts to all of us, spirit and faith through Christ our Lord.
In Schaffhausen, on the 15th of January, 1564.
To the most illustrious man, Mr. Heinrich Bullinger, Antistes of Zurich, my honorable brother. In Zurich.
